sanskrit_verse:
उच्छिष्टमन्नं दातव्यं जीर्णानि वसनानि च ।
पुलाकाश्चैव धान्यानां जीर्णाश्चैव परिच्छदाः ॥ १०.१२५॥
transliteration: ucchiṣṭam annaṁ dātavyaṁ jīrṇāni vasanāni ca | pulākāś caiva dhānyānāṁ jīrṇāś caiva paricchadaḥ || 10.125 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Remnant food must be given; worn garments must be donated; chaff and old coverings of grain must also be offered.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from the act of conscious giving
Causation arises through completion of material cycle
Capacity-based responsibility extends to surplus stewardship
Restoration logic operates through redistribution of residual assets
Consciousness alignment occurs via renunciation of possessiveness
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity possesses remnant food THEN obligation to transfer to needful recipient
IF garment has served its functional purpose THEN automatic donation trigger activates
IF agricultural residue exists THEN it shall be allocated for community use
IF ownership exceeds necessity THEN surplus becomes communal resource
IF possession no longer serves evolution THEN release protocol initiates
supreme_court_application: In adjudication concerning property rights or waste management, the threshold of responsibility lies in recognizing that retention beyond utility constitutes a breach of dharma. The court must ensure that surplus materials are redirected toward those capable of utilizing them, thereby restoring balance without punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that ownership carries inherent obligations tied to utility. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that hoarding residuals disrupts natural flow. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of control over resources. Non-punitive reality rule confirms that justice manifests through conscious reallocation rather than penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate surplus identification audit within holder's domain
Engage completion process to finalize transfer of residual items
Activate capacity restoration by linking giver to receiver ecosystems
Implement integrity reintegration through public acknowledgment of fulfilled duty
Establish ongoing monitoring to prevent future accumulation stagnation
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored through conscious circulation. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
